summary: Experienced Lawyer with a demonstrated history of working in the law enforcement industry. Skilled in Trials, International Law, Evidence Collection, Administrative Law, and Family Law. Strong legal professional with a Certificate focused in Prevention and Administration of Social and Environmental Conflicts in Hydro power Development from International centre for Hydro-power.

The project aimed at Scaling-up Renewable Energy-Program under the Strategic Climate Fund (“SCF-SREP”), where the World Bank agreed to provide the GoR with a loan (SCF SREP Loan Number TF0A4969) and a grant (SCF SREP Grant No. TF0A4990) (together, “SCF-SREP Financing”) to assist in financing the Rwanda Renewable Energy Fund Project (“REF Project”), 

Main responsibilities  include:
 
•	Draft and review the Bank’s legal agreements related to energy deals and provide advice regarding the implications for the Bank, and any actions required by the Bank.
•	Establish record keeping and tracking systems and provide reports to the Project Manager on the status of legal activities.
•	Ensure disputes are resolved in a manner that safeguards Company’s position and in compliance with applicable legislation.
•	Brief and monitor external counsel to ensure legal representation is effective.
•	Develop effective working relationships with key user departments to ensure their needs are understood and appropriate solutions developed that support business needs.
•	Provide legal counsel so as to ensure legal problems and risks are identified and dealt with before they emerge as significant.
•	Execute Legal project administrative related tasks as and when they arise.
•	Execute any other tasks as given by the Project  Manager.', 'title': 'LEGAL OFFICER', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'RWANDA DEVELOPMENT BOARD', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'KIGALI, RWANDA', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'RWANDA DEVELOPMENT BOARD', 'description': '- Ensuring there is legal compliance of the activities of RDB with national and international relevant regulations.
- Managing and being responsible for the legal archive of RDB and for keeping records of contracts/agreements, judgments, instructions and memoranda of understanding concerning RDB;
- Ensure the legality of the procurement process 
- Responsible for drafting, analyzing and reviewing laws, orders, instructions, regulations, rules of procedure and contracts relating to all activities of RDB.
- Responsible for preparing judicial or extra judicial legal actions on behalf of RDB. Receiving summons and be responsible to prepare rebuttal pleadings for RDB.
- Liaise with lawyers and professional court bailiff on judgements concerning the activities of RDB.
- Pleading cases before courts of law and arbitration centre on behalf of RDB.
- Offer legal advice to the Senior Management on the matters mentioned above.
- Responsible for monitoring and updating (the Senior Management of RDB) on relevant domestic and international legal innovations involving Rwanda and the East African Community;
- Responsible to coordinate and implement legal training for RDB staff.', 'title': 'State Attorney  & Legal Advisor', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'National public Prosecution Authority', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'company': 'National public Prosecution Authority', 'description': '-Make a control compilation of crime data,

•	Take care of the matter inscription, management of the files and documents or other judicial acts rising of the Competence of the commercial Court as well as the orientation of the answerable ones.
• Keep the minutes of all the jurisdiction proceedings, as well as the registers and the cause lists of cases introduced, tried and executed.
• Prepares the jurisdiction proceedings intended for parties and notifies the latter of them.
• Prepares the draft verdicts or rulings when necessary and ensures that they get typed.
•  At the beginning of every calendar year, and no later than 15 January, establishes in alphabetical order, a list of all cases decided by the Court and make a summary of the subject matter of the claim in each case', 'title': 'COURT REGISTRAR', 'employment_type': None}]}]
